docs.snippet: Aside from Mirza Teletovic, who had 14 points in Game 2, no reserve has scored in double figures in the playoffs for the Nets, whose depth played a key role in their resurgence this season....
docs.lead_paragraph: Aside from Mirza Teletovic, who had 14 points in Game 2, no reserve has scored in double figures in the playoffs for the Nets, whose depth played a key role in their resurgence this season.
docs.abstract: Brooklyn Nets bench, key cog to their success since the beginning of the year, has yet to prove to be as beneficial in the postseason.

headline.main: Nets’ Bench Is Taking Back Seat in Playoffs
headline.print_headline: Nets’ Bench Is Taking Back Seat in Playoffs

docs.snippet: Joakim Noah, now a star for Chicago, made a lasting impression with his intense, selfless style at Poly Prep Country Day School in Bay Ridge, Brooklyn....
docs.lead_paragraph: Joakim Noah, now a star for Chicago, made a lasting impression with his intense, selfless style at Poly Prep Country Day School in Bay Ridge, Brooklyn.
docs.abstract: Chicago Bulls center Joakim Noah spent two formative years at Poly Prep County Day School in Bay Ridge, Brooklyn, before he joined Bulls, becoming NBA’s defensive player of the year and one of the league’s most infectious personalities; he still possesses the same level of energy and commitment.

headline.main: Bulls Star With Brooklyn Roots Is the Same as Ever: Different

docs.lead_paragraph: Jeff Teague hit a wild 3-pointer after the officials appeared to miss his stepping out of bounds, and Kyle Korver finished off Indiana from beyond the arc as the host Atlanta Hawks scored a 98-85 victory Thursday night over the top-seeded Pacers.
docs.abstract: Atlanta Hawks beat Indiana Pacers, 98-85, to go up by two games to one in the best-of-seven series; other basketball news noted.

docs.abstract: Memphis Grizzlies defeat Oklahoma City Thunder, 98-95, in overtime, to take a 2-1 lead in their best-of-seven NBA playoff series.

docs.snippet: A key front in the effort to reform the N.C.A.A. is medical coverage for college athletes, some of whom have become burdened with costs to treat their injuries....
docs.lead_paragraph: A key front in the effort to reform the N.C.A.A. is medical coverage for college athletes, some of whom have become burdened with costs to treat their injuries.
docs.abstract: Medical care for injured athletes has emerged as a key front in sprawling battle to reform the NCAA; hope is to ensure that current and former athletes never pay out of pocket for sports injuries; under current NCAA rules, players can still lose their scholarships after being hurt, often pay for their own insurance and are generally responsible for long-term health care for injuries sustained on the playing field.

headline.main: A Fight to Keep College Athletes From the Pain of Injury Costs
headline.print_headline: A Fight to Save College Athletes From the Ordeal of Injury Costs
